TopicTitle: !Forum issue! OP disappeared, thread still exists w/o OP

Articles.Content:
Problem

I made this thread to tell people about my mod: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/85388-0-24-Pre-Flight-Checklist-v0-1

The Thesonicgalaxy appears to be the person that started the thread, however I did.

Only comments appear, not the Showcase post

Link to mod: http://www.curse.com/ksp-mods/kerbal/222146-pre-flight-checklist

Events

I updated my mod so I wanted to update the Original Post, I hit save changes and then the post disappeared.

Help!

If anyone has a potential solution please help, it would be greatly appreciated

Ask anything if you need to
As this is not a bug in the game, your thread has been moved to the place to discuss forum issues. However, when I click on your link, I see you as the thread originator and first post.

As this is not a bug in the game, your thread has been moved to the place to discuss forum issues. However, when I click on your link, I see you as the thread originator and first post.

I do not see the OP. Maybe it's hidden to non-mods?

EDIT: If he edited it, is it possible it was re-sent to the mod queue?
I can also confirm, he is NOT the OP.
The thread says it has 8 replies but I cannot see the OP on the page..... but it says 1 of 9 showning so it is detecting the OP as present
Well, this is odd. I just tried the link again, and I still see _Q3's post at the top of the page.
Whatever it was, it's working fine for me now (both logged in and logged out)

Sounds like the following happened:

1. Post was submitted

2. Post was sent to the moderation queue (happens when you have <5 approved posts)

3. Post was approved

4. Post was subsequently edited

5. Post was sent back to the moderation queue after the thread had replies

This would cause the OP to be "hidden" again after it was originally posted.

It shouldn't happen now that you have at least 5 posts.
